item.title: Adani Green soars 19% as group stocks recover sharply amid ongoing U.S. legal challenges
item.description: Shares in India's Adani Group have been rallying on the back of the group's statement refuting bribery charges against its billionaire chairman, Gauta...

item.title: Apple, Trump and a booming budget surplus: Ireland has much to mull over as voters head to the polls
item.description: A budget surplus and concerns over U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's upcoming tax policies are some of the economic questions facing Ireland.

item.title: Shares of drone maker Unusual Machines soar after Donald Trump Jr. joins advisory board
item.description: Donald Trump Jr., the son of President-elect Donald Trump, said "the need for drones is obvious" as he joined the advisory board of Unusual Machines.

item.title: Trump's tariff threats have rattled Europe's auto giants ‚Äî but Ferrari appears remarkably unfazed
item.description: Ferrari is thought to be a special case among Europe's automobile sector even as many car giants come under pressure from the threat of U.S. tariffs.

item.title: Biden says Trump's tariff threat against Canada and Mexico is 'counterproductive'
item.description: Biden said that he hopes Trump "rethinks" his tariff announcement, which would impact two close U.S. allies.

item.title: Ten-year Treasury yields slip to one-month low as traders return after Thanksgiving
item.description: Bond yields dipped early Friday as the market re-opened following the Thanksgiving break.

item.title: Europe markets edge lower as investors await euro zone inflation data; Anglo American up 3%
item.description: European stocks were slightly lower on Friday as investors awaited the release of euro zone inflation data.

item.title: Connecticut's Congress members targeted with bomb threats on Thanksgiving
item.description: Five of the state's seven Democratic members of Congress said they were notified of bomb threats targeting their homes, but no devices were found.

item.title: South Korea stocks lead declines in Asia-Pacific as its industrial production contracts in October
item.description: Tokyo's headline inflation rate came in at 2.6%, rebounding from the 1.8% seen in October.
